prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: Mia's little sister. Currently training to become a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: A gifted prosecutor, and a ruthless man who'd do anything to get a "guilty" verdict.
Character 2
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 3
Name: Will Powers
Description: The defendant. Action star who plays the title role in "The Steel Samurai" TV Show.
Character 4
Name: Security Lady
Description: Security guard at Global Studios. Claims she saw Powers heading to the scene.
Character 5
Name: Jack Hammer
Description: The victim. A former big name action star. Played the role of the Evil Magistrate.
Character 6
Name: Assistant
Description: Name: Penny Nichols. Assistant at Global Studios in charge of large props and set pieces.
Character 7
Name: The Director
Description: Name: Sal Manella. Creator of "The Steel Samurai." Present on the day of the crime.
Character 8
Name: Cody Hackins
Description: A big fan of the Steel Samurai. Present at the studio on the day of the crime.
Character 9
Name: Dee Vasquez
Description: High-ranking producer at Global Studios. Present on the day of the crime.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Powers's Letter
Description: Document proving Will Powers's request for an attorney.
Evidence 2
Name: Guidemap
Description: Guidemap to Global Studios. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Jack's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/15 at 2:30 PM. Cause: Pierced through the chest by a spear.
Evidence 4
Name: Cardkey
Description: Cardkey for Studio Employees. Grants access into Studio One.
Evidence 5
Name: Powers'(?) Photo
Description: Taken at the gate between the entrance and the Studios. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2] He's dragging one leg. Click here for details. [Oct 15, 2:00 PM, Photo #2]
Evidence 6
Name: Samurai Spear
Description: This spear was found stuck in the chest of the victim. The murder weapon. A break in the shaft has been mended with duct tape.
Evidence 7
Name: Empty Bottle → Sleeping Pill Bottle
Description: Found on a table in the employee area. The label reads "Sleeping Pills." Found on a table in the employee area. Bears Jack Hammer's fingerprints.
Evidence 8
Name: Trailer Key
Description: The key tag reads "Studio Two Trailer".
Evidence 9
Name: Vasquez's Memo
Description: The memo read "Bring me the script from Episode 13".
Evidence 10
Name: Script
Description: A Steel Samurai script. The cover reads "Episode 13".
Evidence 11
Name: Mr. Monkey's Head
Description: Blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
Evidence 12
Name: Steel Samurai Card
Description: A trading card. Apparently, these are really popular with kids these days.
Evidence 13
Name: URP Card
Description: An "Ultra Rare Premium" Steel Samurai collectible card. Very valuable.
Evidence 14
Name: "Path to Glory"
Description: Contains photos of every victory scene in every battle the Steel Samurai has won.
Evidence 15
Name: Cody's Camera
Description: A new digital camera. Cody always carries it, though he's still learning how to use it.
Evidence 16
Name: Steak Plate
Description: Found in the employee area. On it are traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
Evidence 17
Name: Five-Year-Old Photo
Description: Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer. Click here for details.
Evidence 18
Name: Van
Description: Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I wanted to see a Steel Samurai rehearsal, just once.
Person: Cody
Testimony 1
Testimony: I found a map on the Internet, and went to the studios that day.
Person: Cody
Testimony 2
Testimony: I went through the woods, off the path, so that old lady wouldn't catch me.
Person: Cody
Testimony 3
Testimony: I was going for the studio.
Person: Cody
Testimony 4
Testimony: I got kinda lost on the way, though. For about 30 minutes.
Person: Cody
Testimony 5
Testimony: When I came out by the studio, there was the Steel Samurai!
Person: Cody
Testimony 6
Testimony: It totally rocked! Right before my eyes, out came the bad guy!
Person: Cody
Testimony 7
Testimony: Of course, the Steel Samurai took him down! Pow!
Person: Cody
Testimony 8
Testimony: If I had my camera with me, that woulda been the time for a shot, I tell you.
Person: Cody

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Alright, let's tackle this problem step by step. I need to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other. First, I'll go through the evidence and testimonies provided to understand what each one says.

Looking at the evidence, there's a list of 19 items, but the key ones here are:

- **Evidence 11**: Mr. Monkey's Head. It mentions that it blocked the path to the crime scene between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.
- **Evidence 16**: Steak Plate. Found in the employee area with traces of sleeping pills and a large bone.
- **Evidence 17**: Five-Year-Old Photo. Shows an accident involving Jack Hammer.
- **Evidence 18**: Van. Manella used this van to drive Vasquez to Studio One after the meeting in the trailer.

Now, looking at the testimonies, there are 9 statements from Cody Hackins:

1. He wanted to see a Steel Samurai rehearsal.
2. He found a map online and went to the studios that day.
3. He went through the woods, off the path, to avoid the security lady.
4. He was going for the studio.
5. He got lost for about 30 minutes.
6. He saw the Steel Samurai at the studio.
7. The Steel Samurai defeated the bad guy.
8. He wished he had his camera to take a shot.

I need to find a contradiction between any of these testimonies and the evidence provided.

Starting with Testimony 3: Cody says he went through the woods, off the path, to avoid the security lady. If he went off the path, he might not have been detected by the security. However, looking at the evidence, there's no direct contradiction here. The security lady's testimonies in previous interactions mention seeing Powers, but not Cody.

Next, Testimony 5: Cody says he got lost for about 30 minutes. If he was lost between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM, that might align with the time when Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path (Evidence 11). However, this doesn't necessarily contradict; it might explain why he was late or took a different route.

Testimony 6: He saw the Steel Samurai at the studio. Evidence 5 shows a photo of Powers at 2:00 PM, which is before the murder time of 2:30 PM. If Cody arrived later, around 2:15 PM or later, he might have seen Powers after the murder, but this isn't a direct contradiction.

Looking at Testimony 4: He was going for the studio. Evidence 18 mentions the van used by Manella to drive Vasquez to Studio One. If Cody was going to Studio One, but the van was already used, this might not directly contradict unless there's a time issue.

The most potential contradiction seems to be between Testimony 3 and Evidence 11. If Cody went through the woods off the path to avoid the security lady, he might have taken a different route. However, Evidence 11 says the path was blocked by Mr. Monkey's Head between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. If Cody was trying to go through the woods during that time, he might have been blocked, which could explain his being lost. But this isn't a direct contradiction; it's more of a situational conflict.

Wait, perhaps I'm overcomplicating. Let me check again. Testimony 3 says he went through the woods to avoid the security lady. If the path was blocked by Mr. Monkey's Head (Evidence 11), he might not have been able to take that route, which contradicts his testimony of successfully avoiding the security lady by going through the woods.

Yes, that makes sense. If the path was blocked, he couldn't have gone through the woods as he claimed. Therefore, Testimony 3 contradicts Evidence 11.
</think>

{"evidence": 11, "testimony": 3}

response:
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let's start by looking at the evidence and testimonies provided.

First, the evidence list includes a lot of items, but the ones that stand out are:

- Evidence 15: Cody's Camera. It's described as a new digital camera that Cody always carries, though he's still learning how to use it.

- Evidence 11: Mr. Monkey's Head. This evidence says that it blocked the path to the scene of the crime between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM.

Looking at the testimonies, Cody Hackins (Character 8) is the one giving them. His testimonies are:

- Testimony 0: "Yeah, you're right, pops." Not much info here.
- Testimony 1: "The Steel Samurai had just escaped from the clutches of the villain."
- Testimony 2: "So I held up my camera to take a picture!"
- Testimony 3: "But the lens wouldn't open in time, so I missed it."
- Testimony 4: "Th-that's all that happened. Yup."
- Testimony 5: "I took a few shots, but it was too late, so I erased 'em."

So, Cody says he tried to take pictures with his camera but couldn't get the lens to open in time, and he ended up erasing some shots. But according to Evidence 15, he always carries his camera. If he was carrying it, why didn't he take any usable photos? Or why did he erase the ones he did take? That seems contradictory because if he had the camera with him, he should have been able to take pictures, but he claims he couldn't get the lens to open and erased the photos he did take. 

Wait, but Evidence 11 says that Mr. Monkey's Head blocked the path to the crime scene between 2:15 PM and 4:00 PM. The time of death was at 2:30 PM. So, if the path was blocked, how did Cody get to the scene? Or was he already there before the blockage? That could also be a contradiction if Cody's testimony about being at the scene doesn't align with the blockage evidence.

Hmm, but the main contradiction seems to be between Cody's testimony about his camera and the fact that he always carries it. He claims he tried to take pictures but couldn't, yet he has a camera with him. Maybe the issue is that if he had the camera, he should have been able to take clear photos, but he says he couldn't get the lens to open and erased the shots. That doesn't make much sense because if he couldn't take the photos, why erase them? Or maybe the camera was malfunctioning, but that's not mentioned.

Alternatively, the contradiction could be between Evidence 11 (Mr. Monkey's Head blocking the path) and Testimony 2 or 3, where Cody says he took some shots but missed it because the lens wouldn't open. If the path was blocked, how did he get there to take photos in the first place? That could be another contradiction.

But I think the primary contradiction is between Evidence 15 (Cody's Camera) and Testimony 5, where Cody says he took a few shots but erased them. If he had the camera, why didn't he have any usable photos? Or why erase them? It seems contradictory because if he had the camera, he should have evidence, but he claims he erased it, which might imply he had something incriminating.

Alternatively, maybe the issue is that Evidence 15 says he always carries the camera, but in his testimonies, he doesn't mention taking any photos except for trying to take some but failing. So the contradiction is that he should have photos but doesn't, which could imply he's hiding something or the camera wasn't working, but that's not clear.

I think the best pair is Evidence 15 (Cody's Camera) and Testimony 5, where he says he erased the photos. That seems contradictory because if he had the camera, why erase the photos? Maybe he's hiding something, or the camera wasn't working as he claimed.
</think>

{"evidence": 15, "testimony": 5}
